Comment: Names are assigned according to the area of the mushroom body they arborize
as detailed in Tanaka et al.
Mushroom body calyx arborizing neuron 1.Definition: Neuron whose cell body is located at the posterior area of the lateral cell body region between the posteriorlateral protocerebrum and the optic lobe. There is only one of these per hemisphere. It projects dorsally towards the lateral horn before branching and extensively arborizing in the ventral part of the lateral horn, then turning medially and terminating in the calyx.
